author: Yee
text:
Third time bought from VC 

First time: the authentication took more than 1 week. So I spent my time and effort to chase after VC, finally it mentioned that the bag did not pass the authentication process.. luckily the money was refunded quickly 

Second time: they sent my parcel from France to Hong Kong using Chronopost. You can google Chronopost and you will definitely understand my thought. When the parcel arrived HK, it mentioned that my phone number was not provided so the parcel was on hold... Finally, thanks to google, I checked the company handling the parcel in HK (myself) and called them so I finally got my bag 

Third time: VC sent the parcel quickly BUT the wrong tracking number was provided by them.. even after a whole week, chonopost said that no shipment could be found. I kept chasing after them again, using live chat! Luckily, one of the customer service representatives decided to escalate my issue (which is very rare from the review here) and she even called me once to assure that VC would treat the issue seriously. She also sent me email and always replied in a few hours (so I didnt have to wait for another ‘expert’ and reply in 2-3days..) 

After a few days, a correct hyperlink to track my parcel was provided. But...... once the parcel arrived HK, the same problem as my second purchase appeared again! And this time even the tracking number provided was incorrect! Luckily, I tried to tell the company handling the parcel in Hk the number found in the link so finally I successfully got the parcel 

In short, i do thanks the representative who escalates my issue! Otherwise, I dont think that I could receive the parcel! However, shopping should never be that tiring! I am writing the review here to remind myself the troublesome, time consuming and frustrating process of getting my parcels! WAIT! I have paid for them and I should not have experienced all these..
title: Frustrating shopping experience

author: Crotti Designs
text:
If I could give zero stars I would. I made a listing for an authentic Celine bag which had been dyed black. I highlighted this in the description and on the photos that show the serial number tag as still being pink leather. The listing was verified and approved. The bag sold on the 17/01/21 and the buyer chose to get the bag authenticated, which is fair. The bag arrived at the vestiare headquarters on the 22/01/21, so four days later (Dublin - Paris with DHL). On the 26/01/21 it was marked non-compliant, and that was the last I heard. The following week I had to get in touch with them to find out what the story was. They claimed it didn't match the description (very untrue) and they also marked it as a failed sale and docked my seller rating to 62%. To add to that I then again (!!!)  had to get in touch to ask when will I get my bag back - The vague response (on the 3/02/21) after the chat was 'Thank you for letting us know you'd like your bag back (seriously??)and that the bag would be shipped back 'in a few days' and that tracking will follow. On the 8/02/21 the bag still hadn't been shipped back. I once again got in touch and was told it would take 3 working days to post the bag back. At this point they have had my item (after it was marked non-compliant) for a solid two weeks and if I hadn't got in touch they wouldn't even have bothered to send me my Celine trio back. I cannot believe the have such awful protocols to deal with non-compliant items given the whole platform only exists because sellers and willing to list item son there (I personally will continue to stick with DEPOP where the service is good and the commission isn't as ridiculously high as Vestiare). This review is from a sellers point of view but I can say that the buying process isn't particularly smooth sailing either - a direct result of the zero communication possible between sellers and buyers. Hopefully by next week (week 3) I will have my item back!

Edit: Week 4 and my item still hasn't been posted back! Maybe by week 5? Who knows!
title: If I could give zero stars I would

author: LISA
text: I bought an expensive coat, shipping from Europe in January. I paid the required import tax/VAT at time of buying it, full amount taken from my account. Courier then contacted me saying they would not deliver until the outstanding import tax (already paid in full to Vestiaire) was paid. Contacted Vestiaire, who said they couldn’t deal with courier, only way to deal with it was to pay the second, duplicate charge, send receipt and they would immediately refund. So I paid again, sent proof of payment. Nothing. Have requested the money is repaid, with supporting proof of payment, multiple times, now asked for a phone call to explain. Nothing. And there is no phone number to contact anyone. Feels very dishonest, and I’m still chasing and waiting for a large sum of money to be repaid into my account. Be very careful of this- I feel like I was duped.
title: Import Double charge
